[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity.
[LEXICON]: Some archaic language (e.g., "irksome task", "bespattered") might reduce readability for modern readers.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from Rosa's early life to the discussion of Joshua Reynolds without clear contextual connection.
[CLARITY]: The narrative jumps between family life, historical events, and artistic development, sometimes without smooth transitions.

[SYNTAX]: Awkward sentence structure in "The sand being flung upon the wet ink, and the blotting done, there was exchange of compliments..." (abrupt shift in context and topic)
[LEXICON]: Overly formal/stilted language in "...stilted manner of good-fellowship of the day..." (distracts from overall readability)
[GRAMMAR]: Missing article in "...in the level stretch of the Monceau quarter..." (minor, but noticeable)

[LOGIC]: Sudden, unconnected transition to "In the years which immediately followed His departure from Persia..." (completely unrelated topic)
[STRUCTURE]: Lack of clear chronological or thematic connection between paragraphs (e.g., shift from Rosa's studies to Persian context)
[CLARITY]: Unclear relevance of "...the gossip is not without authority and weight..." (confuses the narrative focus)
